content.question: An ice skater begins to spin in the "camel" position, as shown in the figure. As she continues to spin, she stands upright, pulls her arms to her chest, and crosses her legs to spin in the "corkscrew" position, as shown in the figure. If friction between the skater and the ice is negligible, which of the following claims is true as the skater moves from the "camel" position to the "corkscrew" position?

choices.label: The skater’s angular speed is increasing in magnitude.
The skater’s angular speed is decreasing in magnitude.
The skater’s angular momentum is increasing in magnitude.
The skater’s angular momentum is decreasing in magnitude.

content.answer: The skater’s angular speed is increasing in magnitude.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
